channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - World

item.dc:creator: Will Hazell and Dominic Penna
item.description: The British plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda had been hampered by a supreme court ruling, but Britain’s prime minister says he has a solution that will placate his party.
item.title: Sunak sends officials to Rwanda to support deportations, as party revolt builds

item.dc:creator: Nidal al-Mughrabi and Najib Jobain
item.description: An agreement to free hostages in exchange for a five-day pause in fighting has been reached, The Washington Post reported, but Israel and the US denied a deal had been done.
item.title: Tentative deal between Israel, Hamas for five-day conflict pause near: report

item.dc:creator: Biswajeet Banerjee
item.description: Rescuers have managed to get through 24 metres of rock so far, but it may require up to 60 metres of drilling to enable the trapped workers’ escape in north India.
item.title: Workers trapped in tunnel for more than a week after rescue drill breaks

item.dc:creator: Michael Levenson
item.description: When Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar died, most of his exotic animals died or were transferred to zoos. Not his four hippopotamuses: they thrived ... Perhaps a little too well.
item.title: Colombia to sterilise Escobar’s ‘cocaine hippos’

item.dc:creator: Joe Skipper
item.description: The rocket’s first stage booster, despite achieving a crucial manoeuvre to separate with its core Starship stage, exploded over the Gulf of Mexico shortly after detaching.
item.title: SpaceX rocket suffers double explosion, but scientists say that’s OK

item.description: During the show, Swift paused her performance and asked from the stage for water to be brought to a group of people who were screaming for water.
item.title: Taylor Swift fan dies at concert in sweltering Rio de Janeiro heat

item.description: SpaceX launched its mega rocket Starship, but lost the booster and then the spacecraft minutes into the test flight.
item.title: SpaceX second test flight ends in eight minutes after explosion

item.description: Patients, staff and displaced people have left Gaza's largest hospital as dozens are killed at a UN shelter.
item.title: Patients and staff leave Gaza's biggest hospital as dozens killed at UN shelter

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: World leaders and diplomats are grappling with the question of what life will look like for Palestinians after the last Israeli bomb falls.
item.title: ‘Menu of highly unpalatable options’: Who will run Gaza after the war?

item.dc:creator: Angus Holland
item.description: Torture and taking hostages are undisputed breaches of international law. Other acts are less clear-cut. Who decided these rules, and how do they work in practice?
item.title: What rules of war apply in the Israel-Hamas conflict?

item.description: Israel says it will place no limit on deliveries of aid as concerns grow about starvation in Gaza.
item.title: Israel says no limit on aid deliveries as starvation concerns grow in Gaza

item.dc:creator: Nidal al-Mughrabi and James Mackenzie
item.description: Such a move could compel hundreds of thousands of Palestinians who fled south from the Israeli assault on Gaza City to relocate again, along with residents of Khan Younis.
item.title: Israel tells Palestinians to leave city in southern Gaza

item.dc:creator: David Lawder and David Brunnstrom
item.description: The 21 APEC members, which include Russia and Muslim-majority Indonesia and Malaysia, went into the meetings divided over the wars and that is how they left.
item.title: APEC leaders divided over Ukraine, Gaza but together on WTO reform

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Saving the best for last, hours after his historic meeting with US President Joe Biden, the Chinese leader delivered a welcome surprise in San Francisco.
item.title: Panda-monium averted: Xi departs US on promise of more panda loans

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: World of Photos - November 19, 2023

item.dc:creator: Francis Kokutse
item.description: Centuries after the end of the slave trade, people of African descent around the world continue “to be victims of systemic racial discrimination and racialised attacks”.
item.title: ‘It is time’: Summit agrees on global fund to compensate Africans for slavery

item.dc:creator: Dana Hull
item.description: The White House too called Elon Musk’s conduct an unacceptable act that endangers Jewish communities.
item.title: Musk amplifies antisemitism on X, sparking advertiser, Tesla shareholder backlash

item.dc:creator: Philip P. Pan, Patrick Kingsley and Thomas Fuller
item.description: Israeli military escorted journalists from The New York Times through a landscape of wartime destruction to a stone-and-concrete shaft at Gaza’s biggest hospital.
item.title: Israel displays tunnel shaft at Al Shifa, agrees to let in fuel to avoid disease

item.dc:creator: Antony Loewenstein
item.description: The two-state solution is the zombie fix that’s resurrected every time the Middle East is on fire and leaders scramble for something nominally sensible to say. It’s time for fresh thinking.
item.title: Two-state solution won’t deliver peace for Israel/Palestine. But this might

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: World of Photos - November 18, 2023
